intro: Hesperoxiphion herrerae, commonly known as the Herrera's hesperoxiphion, is a rare flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of ray and disk florets. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils at high altitudes, showcasing adaptations to its harsh environment. Its flowers are usually small and yellow, with a subtle fragrance that attracts specific pollinators. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
